cyclone.name: FIONA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest this evening, then turning northwest toward Puerto Rico tonight and the eastern Dominican Republic Monday, before curving north into the southwest Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Puerto Rico (near or just south of San Juan)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for U.S. Virgin Islands and portions of the Dominican Republic coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, including Vieques and Culebra
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, eastern Dominican Republic, Turks and Caicos
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds expected to begin Saturday night with a 73% cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and up to 20% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible Sunday night as Fiona strengthens.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the southern and eastern coasts of Puerto Rico, including San Juan Bay entrances.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–16 inches with local maxima near 20 inches likely, causing flash flooding and mudslides.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible debris flow and port access channel shoaling from runoff.
